member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Data.DataShaper.IncrementUnicodeString(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Char})
member.summary: Increments a string by treating it like a number and increments it as per UTF-16 table (default .NET encoding) e.g. ABC becomes ABD. Default .NET encoding for a char is UTF-16 (2 byte/16 bit) FYI: http://csharpindepth.com/Articles/General/Unicode.aspx
member.param: The input string to be incremented.

The minimum character to be allowed in the range. Used in combination with the maximum char, it allows you to set a unicode character boundary for each character. If set to null it defaults to char.MinValue.

The maximum character to be allowed in the range. Used in combination with the minimum char, it allows you to set a unicode character boundary for each character. If set to null it defaults to char.MaxValue.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Data.DataShaper.ValidateInputUnicodeStringForIncrement(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Char})
member.summary: Validates that an input string for incrementing is valid: that it does not contain invalid characters. Also that the minimum char is smaller than the maximum char. Lastly that the minimum and maximum characters are not invalid characters.
member.param: The input string to validate.
The minimum character.
The maximum character.
The list of valid characters.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Data.DataShaper.RollOverString(System.String,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary: Rolls over a string as part of the string increment algorithm e.g. 1A becomes 20.
member.param: The input string to roll over.
The minimum character in the unicode table/range to inckude in the roll over e.g. if input is 1A and and minimum character is 0, then the result will be 20.
The current index of the charectsr we're working on for incrementing. This is to check if it is the first character, in which case an extra character needs to be prepended.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Data.DataShaper.IsUnicodeStringGreaterThan(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two strings, by treating them like numbers as per the UTF/ASCII table i.e. ABC is smaller than ABD. Default .NET encoding for a char is UTF-16 (2 byte/16 bit) FYI: http://csharpindepth.com/Articles/General/Unicode.aspx
member.param: The input string in question.
The string to compare the input string to.
member.returns: Result of the comparison.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Data.DataShaper.StringContainsInvalidCharacters(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Char})
member.summary: Checks whether a string contains characters that are not in the provided list of valid characters.
member.param: The input string to be checked.
The list of characters that are valid i.e. any character in the input that is not in this list is invalid. If a null is passed, the result of this method will always be false.
member.returns: Returns a bool indicating whether or not the input string contains invalid characters i.e. characters that are not included in the validCharacters list.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Data.DataShaper.GetUnicodeStringRange(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Char})
member.summary: Returns a range of unicode strings from the start string to the end string For example, setting the start string to 1A and the end string to 2F it will return a range of: 1A, 1B, 1C ... 1Z, 20, 21, 22 ... 29, 2A, 2B, 2C ... 2F.
member.param: The start of the string range.
The end of the string range.

A list of characters that will considered valid. Any characters outside of this list will not be included in the range. If this parameter is set to null, then all characters in the UTF-16 table are valid and included in the result range.
member.returns: Returns the range of unicode (UTF-16) strings as a list.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.WebServiceClient.ConnectionTest(System.Int32,System.Net.HttpStatusCode@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a GET operation to the server at the base URL to determine if it can reach the server. If a WebException is thrown and its status is connection failure or if the inner exception is a socket exception then the exception is thrown i.e. could not connect to server. Otherwise the WebException is swallowed e.g. a 404 (page not found) WebException could have be thrown, but it still indicates that the web server is online.
member.param: The timeout of the web request

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.WebServiceClient.ConnectionTest(System.String@,System.Int32,System.Net.HttpStatusCode@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a GET operation to the server at the base URL to determine if it can reach the server If a WebException is thrown and its status is connection failure or if the inner exception is a socket exception then the exception is thrown i.e. could not connect to server. Otherwise the WebException is swallowed e.g. a 404 (page not found) WebException could have be thrown, but it still indicates that the web server is online. It also returns the text output from the web request.
member.param: The text output from the web request will be placed in this output parameter.
The timeout of the web request

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.WebServiceClient.ConnectionTest(System.String,System.Int32,System.Net.HttpStatusCode@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a GET operation to the server at the query string appended to the base URL to determine if it can reach the server. If a WebException is thrown and its status is connection failure or if the inner exception is a socket exception then the exception is thrown i.e. could not connect to server. Otherwise the WebException is swallowed e.g. a 404 (page not found) WebException could have be thrown, but it still indicates that the web server is online. It also returns the text output from the web request.
member.param: The string to append to the base url making up the complete URL where the web request will be made to.
The timeout of the web request

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.WebServiceClient.ConnectionTest(System.String,System.String@,System.Int32,System.Net.HttpStatusCode@,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a GET operation to the server at the query string appended to the base URL to determine if it can reach the server. If a WebException is thrown and its status is connection failure or if the inner exception is a socket exception then the exception is thrown i.e. could not connect to server. Otherwise the WebException is swallowed e.g. a 404 (page not found) WebException could have be thrown, but it still indicates that the web server is online.
member.param: The string to append to the base url making up the complete URL where the web request will be made to.
The text output from the web request will be placed in this output parameter.
The timeout of the web request

member.name: T:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.REST.RestWebServiceClient
member.summary: A web service client wrapper that can be used to talk with a REST service on a web server. N.B. A REST web service needs to exist on the web server with methods matching those expected by this RestWebService.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.REST.RestWebServiceClient.GetAllEntities``1
member.summary: Gets all the entities of a REST web service according to this patern: baseURL/{entityName} e.g. http://hostname:1983/User to get all users.
member.typeparam: The name of the entities to get e.g. User
member.returns: A list of the specified entities i.e. a list of users.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.REST.RestWebServiceClient.GetEntityById``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets a specific entity based on its surrogate key according to this pattern: baseURL/{entityName}/{entityId} e.g. http://hostname:1983/User/3 to get a user with the user ID of 3.
member.typeparam: The name of the entity to get e.g. User
member.returns: The entity.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.REST.RestWebServiceClient.PutEntity``1(``0)
member.summary: Puts an entity to the REST web service according to this pattern: baseURL/{baseURL} with the entity serialized into the body of the web request. e.g. http://hostname:1983/User
member.typeparam: The name of the entity to put e.g. User
member.param: The entity to put.
member.returns: The server response message.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.REST.RestWebServiceClient.PostEntity``1(``0)
member.summary: Posts an entity to the REST web service according to this pattern: baseURL/{baseURL} with the entity serialized into the body of the web request. e.g. http://hostname:1983/User
member.typeparam: The name of the entity to post e.g. User
member.param: The entity to post.
member.returns: The server response message.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.REST.RestWebServiceClient.DeleteById``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Deletes an entity with the specified ID on the REST web service according to this pattern: baseURL/{entityName}/{entityId} e.g. http://hostname:1983/User/3 to delete a user with the user ID of 3.
member.typeparam: The name of the entity to delete e.g. User.
member.param: The ID of the entity to be deleted.
member.returns: The server response message.

member.name: T:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula
member.summary: A helper class containing geometry and other maths methods.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.GetRectangleFromVertices(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex)
member.summary: Creates a rectangle given the top left and bottom right vertices.
member.param: The vertex of the top left hand corner of the rectangle.
The vertex of the bottom right hand corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.GetPolygonArea(System.Collections.Generic.List{Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex})
member.summary: Calculates the area of any irregular polygon given its vertices. http://www.mathopenref.com/coordpolygonarea2.html
member.param: The list of vertices of the polygon.
member.returns: Returns the area of the polygon.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.GetTriangleArea(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex)
member.summary: Calculates the area of any triangle given it's three vertices. http://www.mathopenref.com/coordtrianglearea.html
member.returns: Returns the area of the triangle.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.GetRadius(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex)
member.summary: Determines the distance from the center of a circle to the given vertex. It basically gets the distance between two points.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.IsVertexInsideCircle(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if a supplied vertex is located inside this circle.
member.param: The vertex to test for e.g. where the user clicked on the Image Map control.
The vertex marking the center of the circle.
The radius of the circle.
member.returns: Returns true if the vertex is located inside circle.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.IsVertexInsideNonConvexPolygon(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,System.Collections.Generic.List{Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex})
member.summary: Determines whether a given vertex is inside a convex polygon made up of the provided vertices. http://www.mathopenref.com/polygonconvex.html This method is not accurate for concave polygons.
member.param: The vertex to test for e.g. where the user clicked on the Image Map control.
The vertices of the making up the polygon.
member.returns: Returns true if the vertix is inside the polygon.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.IsPolygonConvex(System.Collections.Generic.List{Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex})
member.summary: Determines whether a polygon is Convex. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/471962/how-do-determine-if-a-polygon-is-complex-convex-nonconvex

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.IsVertexInsideConcavePolygon(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,System.Collections.Generic.List{Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex})
member.summary: Determines whether a given vertex is inside a concave polygon made up of the provided vertices. http://alienryderflex.com/polygon/ http://www.mathopenref.com/polygonconcave.html
member.param: The vertex to test for e.g. where the user clicked on the Image Map control.
The vertices of the making up the polygon.
member.returns: Returns true if the vertix is inside the polygon.

member.name: M:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Formula.IsVertexInsideRectangle(Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Utilities.Vertex,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Determines whether a given vertex is inside given a rectangle.
member.param: The vertex to test for e.g. where the user clicked on the Image Map control.
The rectangle to check against i.e. if the vertex is located inside of it.
member.returns: Returns true if the vertex is inside the rectangle.

member.name: T:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb
member.summary: The method/verb of the web request made to the web service. Normally corresponds to typical CRUD (Create/Read/Update/Delete) operations although you should not assume that it directly corresponds to SQL operations i.e. it depends on how the web service was implementated to interpret the verb.

member.name: F:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb.GET
member.summary: A get request. Normally used to query data through the web service.

member.name: F:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb.POST
member.summary: A post request. Normally used the update data through the web service. However, PUT and POST are normally interchangeable depending on the web service implementation.

member.name: F:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb.PUT
member.summary: A put request. Normally used to update data through the web service. However, PUT and POST are normally interchangeable depending on the web service implementation.

member.name: F:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb.DELETE
member.summary: A delete request. Normally used to create data through the web service.

member.name: F:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb.HEAD
member.summary: A head request.

member.name: F:Figlut.Server.Toolkit.Web.Client.HttpVerb.OPTIONS
member.summary: An options request.
